title: Esquimaux (1813) Gospels
description: The Gospels according to St. Matthew, St. Mark, St. Luke, and St. John, translated into the language of the Esquimaux Indians, on the coast of Labrador, by the missionaries of the Unitas Fratrum; or, United Brethren, residing at Nain, Okkak, and Hopedale. Printed for the use of the mission, by The British and Foreign Bible Society.
provider: The British and Foreign Bible Society

language.name: Northwest Alaska Inupiatun
language.location: United States of America, Alaska and Hawaii
language.area: Alaska, Kobuk River, Noatak River, Seward Peninsula, and Bering Strait.
